title: 10. IRRI Agronomy Challenge: Are Insects a Problem? (2 & 6 February 2012)

tasks.task: Observing and identifying insect and animal activity in a rice field
subtasks: Noticing the presence of leaf folder and whirled maggots
Recognizing parasitoid wasp cocoons on leaves
Observing lady beetles and their role in controlling herbivore insects
Noting the presence of dragonflies and their predation on mosquito larvae
Identifying decomposer midges and spider webs in the field
Understanding the role of various insects in maintaining ecosystem balance

tasks.task: Managing pest control decisions based on observed insect life
subtasks: Considering the impact of leaf folder and whirled maggots on rice plants
Evaluating the necessity of insecticide use in the early stages of rice growth
Assessing the role of beneficial insects (parasitoids, lady beetles, dragonflies, midges) in natural pest management
Deciding against insecticide application due to natural pest control and beneficial insect activity

tasks.task: Dealing with rodent damage in the rice field
subtasks: Observing rat activity and damage to seedlings
Acknowledging limited options for addressing rat damage
Noting the potential for continuous rodent monitoring and management
